main event: On 27 August 1954 at Lambert Field, Missouri, a civilian reported a spherical black object, 3 to 10 ft. in diameter, disappearing in New York. It was initially believed to be a balloon until it suddenly gained speed.
interesting points: The object was observed to be spinning and suddenly gained speed after initially resembling a balloon.
It was a visual observation that lasted for 3-4 minutes.
The report indicates that the object was first sighted with the naked eye and later with binoculars.
The witness was a civilian and no photographs were taken of the object.
The conclusion of the report stated that it was a possible balloon, but the sudden acceleration remains unexplained.
sighted object: spherical black object, 3 to 10 ft. in diameter
